page.title: 12Slitting Mill Village.
page.content: {Slitting Mill} is just over 1 mile S.W. of{Rugeley} on the edge of Cannock Chase.The village got its name from the{ Rolling and Slitting Mill} which was working in the 17th and 18th centuries.{Slitting Mill Waterworks,} which pumps over 1 million gallons of water a day from 200 feet below ground, is now on the site of the old slitting mill. The village is small and quiet.There is a school which will soon be closed, a small church, a public house and a post office store, together with some old and new housing. There are beautiful{walks} by the Horn's Pool, following the Rising Brook. Along the stream the remains of dams and pools, which were created to drive the mill wheels, may be seen by observant walkers.
